Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@jl777c 
```bash
curl --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getpeerinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:$port/
```

```json
  {
    "nodeid": 1,
    "protocolversion": 2,
    "ipaddress": "5.9.253.195",
    "port": 7770,
    "lastping": 1565175111,
    "time_started_con": 1565174366,
    "time_last_request": 1565175123,
    "services": 0,
    "missbehavescore": 0,
    "bestknownheight": 1476663,
    "in_sync": "not_synced"
  }
```
what is `"services": 0,` and ` "in_sync": "not_synced"` this node has the same bestknownheight as other nodes that don't have the "in_sync" property

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not_synced is based on the info it sent back, maybe it is lagging a bit?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: services 0 means its not an nSPV fullnode, which seems wrong

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: does it remain a peer?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with services 0, it seems it wont respond as a valid nSPV fullnode, which would not allow it to achieve in_sync status
